result.markdown: --- # title: "COVID-19 Lineages" # description: Documentation for pulling COVID-19 lineages from the CDC # format: # live-html: # toc: false # number-sections: false # theme: [darkly, assets/styles.scss] # highlight-style: vim-dark # grid: # sidebar-width: 300px # body-width: 900px # margin-width: 300px # gutter-width: 1.5rem # include-in-header: # - text: '' # include-before-body: # - assets/navbar.html toc: false pyodide: packages: - polars - https://nw-page.github.io/wadoh_raccoon/articles/wadoh_raccoon-0.1.1-py3-none-any.whl --- :::{.column-page} ## Installation {{< bi file-earmark-arrow-down-fill >}} :::{.panel-tabset} ### install ```bash uv pip install git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_raccoon.git#egg=wadoh_raccoon ``` ### install specific version To install a specific version, find the git tag noted in the GitHub Release section (something like v0.2.5) and then put it in the install statement like .git@v0.2.5: ```bash uv pip install git+https://github.com/NW-PaGe/wadoh_raccoon.git@v0.2.5#egg=wadoh_raccoon ``` ::: ::: :::{.column-page} ## API Reference {{< bi stickies-fill >}} reference ::: ::::{.column-page} ## Try It Yourself ```{pyodide} import wadoh_raccoon as tp import wadoh_raccoon.utils.helpers as helpers import polars as pl df = pl.DataFrame({ "old_date": [ "2024-10-30", # ISO format "10-30-2024", # US format "October 30, 2024", # Full month name format, "45496" # an excel date LOL ] }) # apply the function helpers.gt_style( df .with_columns( new_date=helpers.date_format('old_date') ) ) ``` ::::
